title: MCI Server Detail
description: Schema for Model Control Interface (MCI) server metadata and configuration.

name.description: Human-readable server name. Must be unique within the registry.

namespace.description: Unique reverse-DNS format identifier for the server. Used to prevent naming conflicts across different publishers.

description.description: Clear explanation of what the server does, its main features, and use cases.
examples: Provides real-time weather data and 7-day forecasts using the OpenWeatherMap API
Manages file operations including upload, download, search, and organization

iconUrl.description: HTTPS URL to a square icon representing the server (recommended: 256x256px PNG or SVG).

version.description: Semantic version following semver.org format (MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH with optional pre-release and build metadata).

homepage.description: HTTPS URL to the server's homepage, documentation, or project website.

repository.description: HTTPS URL to the server's source code repository (GitHub, GitLab, etc.).

authors.description: List of people who created, contribute to, or maintain this server.

name.description: Full name of the author or contributor.

email.description: Valid email address for contacting the author.

url.description: Optional URL to the author's website, GitHub profile, or social media.

license.description: List of SPDX license identifiers. See https://spdx.org/licenses/ for valid identifiers.

isVerified.description: Indicates if this server has been officially verified by the MCI registry. This field should only be set by the registry authority, not by server authors.

verifiedBy.description: Name of the authority or registry that verified this server. Only present when isVerified is true.

verifiedAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the server was verified.

source.description: Container image configuration specifying how to run this server.

id.description: Unique identifier for this container image definition within your system.

type.description: Container runtime type. Currently only 'docker' is supported.

name.description: Full Docker image name including registry and namespace (e.g., 'docker.io/library/alpine' or 'myregistry.com/team/app').

tag.description: Docker image tag specifying the version or variant to use.

digest.description: SHA256 digest of the image for immutable identification and verification. Ensures you get exactly the intended image version.

config.description: JSON Schema defining the configuration parameters this server accepts. Used to validate user-provided config at runtime.

type.description: Must be 'object' for a valid JSON Schema root.

properties.description: Defines the configuration fields the server accepts.

required.description: List of required configuration field names.

options.description: Docker run flags and their arguments (e.g., port mappings, environment variables, volume mounts).

flag.description: Docker CLI flag (short or long form).

argument.description: Value or argument for the flag. Can be omitted for boolean flags.

commands.description: Pre-defined commands that can be executed within the container.

name.description: Human-readable command identifier used to invoke this command.

value.description: Actual shell command and arguments executed in the container.

description.description: Optional explanation of what this command does.
